content.description: This is the farthest route on the right of this cliff and my favorite of the four routes here. We used some holds to the right that probably brought the grade down to 5.10. Start up the ramp to the right, climb over a bulge, and then move up some nice, steep face moves.
content.protection:
6 bolts to a two bolt anchor with steel 'biners - this anchor is shared with "

I like Orders

."
content.location: It is the furthest right of four bolted lines on this face.

content.description: Stickclip the first bolt, and climb up the scary, loose steel section to a ledge. You can also traverse in from the left, but that's even looser! Bushwhack left along the ledge a few feet, and head up face moves. We broke a lot of small pieces of rock off this climb. It needs more traffic!
content.protection: Seven bolts to a two-bolt anchor with quicklinks.
content.location:
This is the leftmost of four bolted routes here and shares a start with

One Total Catastrophe is Just the Beginning

.

climbs.name: One Total Catastrophe is Just the Beginning

content.description:
This uses the same very chossy start as

This Calls for Immediate Discussion

, but it get much better above. A hard move off the vegetated ledge gets you to some nice face climbing. Stickclip the first bolt due to loose rock at the start.

It looks like you could get to the anchors from the back pretty easily to set up a toprope.
content.protection: Seven bolts to a two bolt anchor with quicklinks.
content.location: From the belay platform, head up and left.

content.description: Stickclip the first bolt, and climb straight up to the bolt to avoid loose rock. Follow the bolts up fun face climbing to the top. This is alittle chossy at the beginning but not as bad as the two routes to the left!
content.protection: Eight bolts to a two bolt anchor with small steel 'biners.
content.location: From the belay platform, scramble up a ramp to the right to the groove below the first bolt. The route stays just right of the blocky chimney that splits this face down the middle.
